title: Not a time-leap pingpong novel...keep reading
content: You think you know how this is going but you don't.  The thrill of the "ride" isn't even just how she gets from point A (back) to point B but the unexpected twists along the way.  I'm not usually a binge reader but I couldn't put it down.  I nearly didn't stick with it because she took so long getting to the first conflict point and I thought oh this is just going to ping pong between alternate realities, falling asleep in one and waking in the other.  I was wrong -- what she did was sooo much more interesting.  Fantastic story telling.  Even the ending was a surprise.  And I like she kept the cast of characters small.  Some books I have to keep a cheat sheet going to keep it straight.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2024

title: In Five Years
content: Wow, where to begin?  This is a story of love and friendship between two bestfriends, Danielle "Dannie" and Bella who are loyal to one another and no matter the situation, always having the other's back.  Everything was ok until it wasn't.  So moving.  Dannie is a lawyer who has always known what she wants and how to get there with her career, her friends, her fiance and her life.  Bella is the artist and seemingly flighty, loving quick and often and moving from project to project without completion, but the two get each other best friends since 7 years old.  Dannie has her life planned out until she has a dream that seems more like a vision that take her 5 years into the future with a different man and apartment on December 15, 2025.  When waking from her dream which doesn't seem like a dream to Dannie back to December 15, 2020 but she doesn't tell Bella or anyone about it for fear of being thought crazy.  Well of course the guy from the future she meets, but without spoiling it, everything is turned upside down.  I was kind of happy with the first realization and the end of the book of the situation of Dannie and her guy in the dream, but the final ending was just anti-climatic and kind of, "huh".
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022

title: Verified Purchase

title: Where do you see yourself in five years?

She also anticipates the proposal of marriage that evening at the celebratory dinner. All of this is aligned with her five year plan. They return to their shared apartment after dinner and she falls asleep on the couch.

title: Verified Purchase

post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: What truly bothered me was the cancer parts... It was a bit disturbing..knowing a close loved one myself that went through it all and fortunately survived; but hard to read about it and then see 2 people bond or "grieve" over it. I am not saying it can't happen, but it just seemed a bit tacky for the end. There could have been other ways to have it end rather than have Bella die from cancer. Perhaps she could have told Danni something like "I want you to be with Aaron/Greg if something happens to me" , that would have been much more romantic and guilt free, since Bella always knew that Danni deserved love and didn't feel that way with David. I also that they way things ended with David were way too abrupt.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024

title: I ugly cried. A lot.
content: Accountant Dannie Kohan has the perfectly planned controlled outlook on life that only the young can afford. She has everything planned out, especially the next five years. On the night of her by the book marriage proposal she falls asleep only to wake up in the future lying in another man’s bed with a wedding ring on. Shook by the vision, she forgets about it until she runs into the man four years later.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020

title: Verified Purchase
content: I really like Dannie, our number loving main character.  She is an authentic and clever protagonist for this brilliantly crafted story. Fantastical but believable, I was hooked immediately! Dannie believes one must sacrifice to achieve their dreams. Refreshingly, her best friend Bella is the opposite of Dannie’s non carefree existence. Bella is spontaneous, fluid, carefree, artsy, wide open. Serle beautifully and descriptively captures big emotions – “I feel as if all the air on the sidewalk has been sucked back into the sky. We’re going to suffocate out here.” And this book is full of big emotions. Heartbreaking and physically moving, this book wrecked me. I had to put sunglasses on to hide my tears.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2024

post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: The main character, Dannie, cares about nothing but her career and her best friend, Bella. Bella cares about Dannie, her endless string of boyfriends, and (spoiler alert) the baby she thinks that she's pregnant with when she meets the 'right' guy, at the 'right' age, to be pregnant, but not at all about the baby she aborted in her twenties---because babies, or 'fetuses,' only have value when when the guy is hot and perfect with a good job and the pregnancy happens in one's thirties. I found Bella's eagerness to decorate a nursery and buy baby clothes within a couple of days after a positive pregnancy test to be quite disturbing when contrasted with the implied abortion. It's not like the uber-wealthy Bella could not have afforded a child in her twenties. But at least Bella, with her cold, uncaring parents, has reasons to be morally skewed. Dannie is just a selfish workaholic married to her career ambitions.  She wasted seven years of David's life (the one decent character), and she seems to feel very little remorse about just how bad she screwed him over. In an imagined future with her final love interest, the doctor, I hope that he, who is at least devoted to a career that matters unlike Dannie's oh-so-important corporate mergers, runs far, far away from Dannie before they pop out a kid or two that neither has the time, and in Dannie's case, the nurture factor, to raise. I find it funny that  Dannie would probably be as bad or even worse than Bella's mother at parenting. Yuck!!! Poor David! Or maybe lucky-escape David?
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024

title: Good book
content: The reviews were compelling and surprisingly accurate, although the reading journey came with many plot twists and unexpected results. The unique story and beginning sets the stage for this lively first-person storytelling that begins in a world of well-planned certainly of a young, successful woman, Dannie, an attorney, and dedicated New Yorker, having her own way. Then things change, or truly she changes. This story is about discovering who she really is, against all her better judgment, guided by a childhood friend, Bella, whose artistic and bohemian lifestyle often seems at odds with Dannie's buttoned-up and logical approach to life.

title: When Life's Plans Go Awry
content: If you or someone you know likes to plan life by the milestones, you will enjoy this book.  Protagonist Dannie Kohan is the kind of young woman who always has the perfect answer (and it is genuine, not faked) to that ubiquitous job interview question, "Where do you see yourself in five years?" Dannie has rules for how long to date someone before moving in together, how old you should be when you get engaged, what age you should get married, when should you land your perfect job, etc.  She is well on her way to achieving her wildest aspirations when she is gobsmacked by a powerful dream, in which she sees herself in an intensely erotic situation with a man she has never met instead of her fiancé David. She is so shaken she goes to a therapist for advice.  She tries to put the incident behind her, because everything else is happening according to her life's plan. I'd have to give a spoiler to say how Dannie meets the man about whom she dreamed or what happened afterwards, but don't assume a book will turn out a certain way.  Read it to find out.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2023

title: A fun read that kept me guessing what the title meant.
content: Dannie is a buttoned-up, hard-driving lawyer who believes that success and happiness are merely a series of well-planned, perfectly-executed, consecutive steps, checking off all the boxes of a well-managed life.  Bella is artistic, mercurial, spontaneous and free-spirited. The two forge a friendship from childhood that flourishes into their adult years, despite their differences.  Dannie is happily engaged to David, and she appears to be solidly on track toward her expected future.  Then, she has an odd dream that she cannot shake.  In any other book, this plot twist might seem cheesy or contrived, but here, at least for me, it worked.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020

title: Verified Purchase
content: Suddenly, Dannie’s comfortable world takes some unanticipated detours, as she grapples with circumstances that she can no longer  control.  Then, the complicated, long-standing friendship between Dannie and Bella is tested.  The easy laughter and shared experiences shift to more serious terrain.

title: Verified Purchase
content: I devoured this book. I loved the writing- so often, the lines seemed just so poetic and I had to stop and re read a sentence or 2. I adored the love between Danni and Bella, and I was so glad the story didn't take us where I thought it might, when I started the book. I loved all the details- from what someone was wearing, to the building across the NY neighborhood, I really could "see" where we were going and I felt very connected to the setting. This book will be a keeper and I'm sure I will revisit.

title: love the author, not the novel
content: This book was incredibly well written. If you seek quality writing, Serle is your girl. Despite this, I did not like the main character. She’s incredibly arrogant and dismissive of those around her. She does not know how to keep her hands to herself and the possessiveness she has over her best friend is concerning. I will continue to read more books from this author, but am disappointed to see cheating as a pattern in her stories.

title: Verified Purchase
content: These are people you will care about.  A wonderful, loving friendship between Dannie and Bella, two women who could not have less in common.  But this friendship is so well written that it all makes sense.  The premise of a dream of a different life five years hence is intriguing and moves the  plot along.  A delightful read!
